name: ITP No 07 - Hydraulics - Stormwater
template name: FCQA - ITP No 07 Rev. 002 - Hydraulics - Stormwater

name: REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Check documents are current & for construction Check levels & falls
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Mark out pipe locations and co-ordinate with other trades.
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation and AS3500.2 Table 9.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pipes to be supported as per AS3500.2 Table 9.1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pipes to be laid in straight lines between changes of directions. Pipes are to be laid on base of crushed hard rock or coarse washed sand.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Check that all sealants & adhesives are compatible with pipe materials.
○ Pipework selection and sizes as per specifications and for construction drawings and AS 3500.
○ Verification that delivered products are as per specification & approved samples.
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Underground pipework to have identification tape installed.
REFERENCE - Specifications, design documentation and issued for construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pits to have smooth, seamless finish using steel trowel or concrete cast in steel frames. Design and for construction drawings
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation and AS3500.3 section 10
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Hold/Witness point, invitation to inspect Hydrostatic Testing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pipes are to be laid on base of crushed hard rock or coarse washed sand. The balance of the trench to be filled and compacted with selected removed spoil.
REFERENCE - Area cleaned and fit for following trade commencement.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Final clean and grade site area affected by the Stormwater scope of works
○ Excess spoil removed from site by as per contract terms
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Verify all inspections, complete records clean and flush entire installation.
○ CCTV of all completed pipe work. Submission to be completed and submitted to BESIX Watpac.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Provide Requirement as per contract documentation including Dimensioned, Surveyed, Falls, Locations and Components. Provide verifications of testing.
ITP No 13 - Hydraulics - Inground Sewer Drainage
template name: FCQA - ITP No 13 Rev. 002 - Hydraulics - Inground Sewer Drainage

name: REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, For construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Check documents are current & for construction Check levels & falls
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, For construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Mark out pipe locations and co-ordinate with other trades
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Excavate trenches to minimal size Grade Trenches to Falls
○ Check that delivered products are as per specification & approved samples
○ Note that all sealants have been checked for compatibility with materials
REFERENCE - Subcontract documentation, For construction drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Adequate Protection Installation as per specification
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Connection permit received Authority procedures followed
○ Hold/Witness point, all inground sewer to be inspected prior to backfill
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Backfill pipe with 10mm blue metal then backfill with selected excavated material.
○ Reference to adequate compaction in accordance with AS 1289
REFERENCE - Area cleaned and fit for following trade commencement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Final clean and grade site area affected by the stormwater scope of works
○ Excess Spoil removed from site by others
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Hydraulic Consultant (LCI) notification and witness point where required.
○ CCTV inspection of all complete Sewer installations
